intro: Siphocampylus rectiflorus, commonly known as the straight-flowered siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes parsley, carrots, and celery, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Siphocampylus rectiflorus is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for various health purposes.
